Techniques: Used a RF transmitter to control sewage pumping stations
Goal: Revenge for failing to get a job at the company
Impact: Millions of gallons of untreated sewage were released into waterways and local parks
Reaction: Hired team of private investigators who located the attacker

Threat Actors: US Gov / Israel Gov / British Gov
Techniques: Malware that exploits 4 zero days / attacked S7 protocol / targeted SCADA & PLCs
Goal: Sabotage the nuklear program by destroying centrifuges that spin nuklear material at enrichment facilities
Impact: Delayed Iran's nuklear R&D for years by shutting down about 1000 centrifuges at the main enrichment facility (1/5 of Irnas's centrifuges); modification or/and creation of cyber strategies in the world; increase in awareness of cybersecurity issues
Notes: Often considered to be the first cyber weapon

Techniques: Social engineering / Spearphishing / Exploitation of Windows and AAD vulnerabilities / RATs
Impact: harvesting sensitive competitive proprietary operations and project-financing information about oil and gas field bids and operations

Techniques: Worm using a stolen digital certificate and other techniques similar to Stuxnet
Notes: Duqu bears a striking similarity to Stuxnet in terms of design philosophy / internal structure and mechanisms / implementation details and the estimated amount of effort needed to create it

Target: Saudi Aramco (largest energy company worldwide) / RasGas (Qatari natural gas company)
Impact: overwrote data on over 30.000 computers with an image of a burning American flag
Reaction: Purchase much of the world's hard drives

Techniques: Espionage Virus using the same framework as Duqu and using microphones / web cameras / key stroke logging / extraction of geolocation data from images
Information Stealer Malware using the same framework as Duqu / ability to steal funds and monitor data from clients of several Lebanese banks

Country: US / Saudi Arabia / South Korea + more

Success: Gather intelligence from the compromised organizations
column17: Information harvested from infected networks was reused in later attacks

Target: Target Store's heating / ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC)
Techniques: Part of a widespread operation that used a trojan tool known as Trojan.POSRAM
Goal: Steal credit card data from Target Stores

Target: Bowman Dam (Small dam near Rye Brook (New York))

Threat Actors: Russian Civilian and Military Intelligence Services (RIS) aka GRIZZLEY STEPPE aka Dragonfly aka Energetic Bear

Techniques: Security Bug & Vulnerability Exploited by Attackers

Threat Actors: RIS aka GRIZZLEY STEPPE aka Dragonfly aka Energetic Bear
Techniques: BlackEnergy malware used for recon / No ICS/SCADA protocol or PLC payloads but mostly on the IT side / Initial infiltration via macro documents -> user credential compromise for access and manual manipulation of SCADA controls (HMI/rdesktop) / Firmware attacks (Uninterruptable Power Supply (UPS) / serial-to-ethernet) / Stage 2: 6 months learning about the environment (looking for assets and found 700 Windows PCs) / The attackers effectively became remote operators / After 6 months (dwell time) the attackers started to disconnect power and uploaded malware to serial-to-ethernet devices
Impact: Power outage (67 substations disconnected at distribution level) -> 230.000-250.000 people without power in freezing temperatures

Techniques: Required significant pre-positioning / Many ICS/SCADA protocol payloads / many behaviors on both IT & OT side / Credential capture via Mimikatz (could be detected with a signature-based approach) -> Compromised user accounts & attacker created accounts / Used LoL (?) commands to pivot into ICS/SCADA via Windows LM/SQL / Spoofed ICS/SCADA command messages / At transmission level / Blueprint / not a targeted attack / Infection vector (kill chain stage 1) is unknown
Impact: 700.000 people (1/5 of Kiev) without power in freezing temp (?)
alter the amount of chemicals entering the water supply and affect water treatment and production capabilities
Time of Discovery: causing water supply recovery times to increase

System Type: Self-replicating ransomware using EternalBlue (SMB zero day developed by the NSA and disclosed by another hacker group)

Threat Actors: RIS aka GRIZZLEY STEPPE aka Dragonfly aka Energetic Bear
Impact: Compromised a number of ICS equip- ment vendors
Time of Discovery: infecting their software with a RAT

Techniques: SIS Tampering: Contained Safety PLC (SPLC) / Safety Instrumented System (SIS) payloads / relied on operator placement & execution / Modified control logic (reprogrammed SPLC/SIS to allow unsafe conditions to persist) / Exploited a vulnerability (injected custom PowerPC payload exploiting a vulnerability in the device firmware to escalate privileges disabling RAM/ROM consistency checking etc.)

Target: Aluminum producer Norsk Hydro's Production Line in 03/2019 / American chemical companies (+others)
